choices.A: Allow HTTP traffic from each device to Control Hub.
choices.D: Acquire a license for each device.
choices.C: Configure the Control Hub organization ID on the devices.
choices.B: Upgrade all the devices to software version CE9.15 or later.

questions.question_text: The chief technology officer at a company must reduce collaboration infrastructure costs by onboarding all on-premises equipment to the cloud by using Cisco Webex Control Hub. Administrators need the ability to manage upgrades and set up hot desking for on-premises devices. Which action must be taken before onboarding devices by using the Control Hub?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Prerequisites:
Software version CE9.15 or later.
Encrypted version of CE software.
Control Hub access as a device or org admin.
You need to have IP addresses, usernames, and passwords for all the devices that you want to migrate.
HTTPS connectivity to your devices for the Device Connector tool.

Source: https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nutc0dy/Cloud-onboarding-for-Board,-Desk,-and-Room-Series

Selected Answer: D
It is importan to mention that the question is not talking about in a specific device type. They could be ip phones, Telepresence devices, webex devices, desk devices, etc. so I do not think B be correct.
In fact, it is necessary to allow devices to reach control hub, A must be correct, to provision and download firmware updates. However, also it is true that the devices, since they are onboarding and changing from CUCM to Control Hub, need to have a license with a Flex Plan,
The caveat is that A talk about HTTP. It must be HTTPS using TLS1.2.
SO I think correct answer is D. It is necessary to have licenses for each one device in general. You must verify that sufficient Webex Device licenses are available to support your devices in the cloud.

Selected Answer: B
see below comment

questions.question_text: What is a capability of the call forwarding feature in a Cisco Webex dial plan?

An engineer is deploying the Webex app on a Microsoft Windows computer that has multiple user accounts. Which CLI argument allows the engineer to install the application as a “per machine” installation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
ALLUSERS=1
Installs Webex App in c:\program files. This is useful in a shared environment (typically non-persistent VDI). This is a mandatory argument for installation. VDI must be installed per HVD. Per user installation is not supported yet. "per machine" means per HVD
Deployment guide for Webex App for Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI)

Selected Answer: B
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nw5p67g/Webex-App-%7C-Installation-and-automatic-upgrade#Cisco_Reference.dita_de4f9295-316d-4e1c-8f47-329ddfdb984d

"When you set ALLUSERS=1 to specify a per computer installation, you must have administration access privileges. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/msi/allusers for more details."

questions.question_text: An engineer is deploying the Webex app on Microsoft Windows computers. The engineer wants to ensure that the end users do not receive pop-up dialogues when they start the application. Which two actions ensure that the end users are not prompted to accept the end-user license agreement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Reference:
"Webex App | Installation and automatic upgrade"
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nw5p67g/Webex-App-|-Installation-and-automatic-upgrade#Cisco_Reference.dita_de4f9295-316d-4e1c-8f47-329ddfdb984d

Selected Answer: DE
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nw5p67g/Webex-App-%7C-Installation-and-automatic-upgrade#Cisco_Reference.dita_de4f9295-316d-4e1c-8f47-329ddfdb984d

The end-user license agreement doesn't appear when you set either of the following registry entries to eula-disabled:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting

Selected Answer: DE
ACCEPT_EULA

Set this property TRUE to accept the end-user license agreement on behalf of users. The installer doesn't prompt users to accept the end-user license agreement.

For example: msiexec /i c:\work\Webex.msi ACCEPT_EULA=TRUE ALLUSERS=1.


 
The end-user license agreement doesn't appear when you set either of the following registry entries to eula-disabled:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting

choices.E: Set the “HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting” registry key to “eula_disabled”.
choices.D: Set the “HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\CiscoCollabHost\Eula Setting” registry key to “eula_disabled”.

questions.question_text: Which Webex Calling dial plan settings restrict a user from placing a particular outbound call type?
